intro: Ilysanthes inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are strap-shaped and evergreen, providing a lush green backdrop to its showy blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
